intro: Brachystelma elegantulum, commonly known as the elegant leafless ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, often blooming in late winter or early spring. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
